title: Exploring Linguistic Interdisciplinary Complementarity in Vocational and Liberal Arts Education: Understanding Through Empirical Case Studies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic pedagogical concepts, general understanding of vocational education systems, fundamental language expression and reading comprehension skills
context.additional_context: Primarily middle-aged adult learners with workplace experience accessing education via smartphones. Emphasis on linguistic interaction activities (text analysis, writing, discussions) within the curriculum.

learning_goals: Explain the conceptual differences and interconnections between vocational and liberal education from a linguistic perspective.
Evaluate the feasibility and linguistic integration of liberal education elements within vocational education through empirical case analysis.
Propose specific implementation plans for expansive pedagogical approaches in vocational education, including strategies to enhance communication and expression skills.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
